title: Problem Solving & Decision Making
objectives:
1. Identify problem and opportunities 
2. Conduct investigations and apply the findings 
3. Identify the key stages in problem-solving and opportunity-finding 
4. Select the most appropriate ways for solving problems

title: Effective Communication Skills for Non-Supervisors
objectives:
1. Build a better rapport and gain the trust of colleagues with different communication styles
2. Learn basic communication skills to facilitate effective communication in daily work
3. Avoid mistakes and conflicts that may result from misinterpreting others or ineffective listening
4. Apply communication skills that will help foster collaborative relationships both internally and externally

title: Effective Communication Skills for Non-Supervisors
objectives:
1. Build a better rapport and gain the trust of colleagues with different communication styles 
2. Understand empathy and develop skills to understand others' perspectives 
3. Avoid mistakes and conflicts that may result from misinterpreting others or ineffective listening 
4. Enhance empathic communication skills to foster team collaboration

title: Innovation At Work - Tools and Tactics
objectives:
1. Understand the basic principles of creativity and innovation 
2. Apply various lateral-thinking techniques to generate ideas and alternatives 
3. Propose innovative solutions convincingly

title: Mastering Emotion to Build Team Effectiveness for Non-supervisors
objectives:
1. Recognise the mind, body and emotions system and its effect on you
2. Gain understanding on how emotions impact people in the workplace
3. Transform stress into motivational energy 
4. Understand the method of reframing and dissociation
5. Foster a team collaboration spirit to overcome challenges at work

title: Writing Persuasive Executive Papers
objectives:
1. define a precise, strategic objective for each paper 
2. persuade their readers to act by emphasising the benefits of acting 
3. meet their readers’ needs more directly in each section of their paper 
4. communicate complex ideas simply and more clearly 
5. enhance their own professional image

title: Effective Emails Writing Workshop
objectives:
1. Identify writing objectives and readers’ needs in different emails 
2. Plan, structure and organise the writing 
3. Write more clearly, precisely and concisely 
4. Use simple, active, direct and highly readable grammar structure

title: Chinese Rhetorical 中文修詞
audience: Staff who are required to write articles, reports, notices, speeches and/or other documents in Chinese language in their daily work.
objectives:
1. Select the appropriate words and tone in a sentences/passage 
2. Mastery of stylistic rules intended to transform the skills to write appropriate and effective Chinese language documents

title:
Putonghua Pinyin and Zhengyin Workshop 
(普通話拼音及正音速成班)
audience: Staff who are required to have a basic level of Putonghua proficiency, or foundation knowledge of 'Pin Yin', and frequent job needs in speaking Putonghua.
objectives:
1. Strengthen the skills of applying 'Pin Yin' to pronounce Chinese words 
2. Reinforce listening skills to recognise 'Pin Yin' transcription 
3. Rectify pronunciations by correcting the position of tongue and shape of lips

title: Persuasive Emails Writing for Results
objectives:
1. Identify your writing challenges 
2. Plan, structure and draft e-mails for tough situations that get the right response 
3. Incorporate language structures to communicate your e-mails clearly and purposely 
4. Use an appropriate tone that maintains your credibility and enhances your reputation 
5. Apply techniques to effectively draft persuasive style documents in order to receive a positive outcome

title: Persuasive Presentation Workshop
audience: For managers who want to improve their presentation skills and deliver persuasive presentation
objectives:
1. Plan and organise professional presentations 
2. Acquire the underlying skills of spoken communication 
3. Have confidence in delivering presentations 
4. Turn a boring topic into an interesting one 
5. Apply tools in order to convince and connect with the audience

title: Think on Your Feet® for Managers
audience: For managers who need to train up their skills to anaylze, organise and present their ideas fast. Not limited to formal presentation and more on informal communication.
objectives:
1.To learn the latest best business practices and refine their skills
2.To understand the political opinions and community concerns

title: Advancing Leadership Effectiveness with Innovation – The Peter Drucker Way
audience:
For managers who need to lead the team to the right focus,
and resolve evolving challenges for achieving business
objectives.
objectives:
1.Understand Drucker’s model of effective leadership with contemporary principles of innovation, problem solving and decision making
2.Guide the team as a leader to do the right things and live the 80-20 Rule with the adaptability to change
3.Advance personal and team effectiveness by practising a strategic and principle-based approach to action planning

title: Communicating with Assertiveness: Resolving Problems Constructively
audience: For managers who wish to enhance the techniques of assertiveness - whether you are an aggressive type or a submissive type.
objectives:
1. Understand the essence of assertiveness through identification of the key attributes of effective assertive behaviours as well as the barriers of communication, facilitating the demonstration of assertiveness and overcome roadblocks when speaking up
2.Grasp of techniques of building trust with others while upholding assertiveness in discussions, positively engaging others to reach constructive conversations
3.Practice and transform to be an assertive communicator through application of six assertive skills and CAP model

title: Acquiring the Right Person through Competency-Based Interview
audience: For managers who want to develop effective skills to enhance the interview process for getting the right candidate for the job.
objectives:
1.Appreciate the role and significance of a recruiter and the expected behaviors
2.Project a positive and motivating impression in the selection process
3.Design and apply competency-based behavioral interview techniques to conduct a structured interview
4.Evaluate candidates objectively by eliminating the inclination to evaluate by impression
5.Practice responding to various challenging interview situations and questions from interviewees
6.Be aware of the ordinances relating to staff recruitment

title: Excelling EQ Power to Lead an Effective and Cohesive Team
audience: For managers who want to maximize effective working relationships by using EQ competences.
objectives:
1. Identify individual EQ strengths and  development areas through an EQ Competence Assessment 
2. Gain understanding on how emotions impact people in the workplace 
3. Acquire skills in managing team emotions for improving their work performance 
4. Develop proficiency in those emotional competencies important to business and project success at MTR 
5. Understand and apply the “EQ framework for Managers” in the workplace and how it applies to business environment

title: Leading and Facilitating Effectively for Achieving Optimal Results in High-stakes Meeting
objectives:
1.Understand some guiding principles of facilitation and to structure an effective facilitation process in team discussions or meetings
2.Encourage participation and generate creative ideas from team members in meetings through acquiring and practicing facilitation tools 
3.Lead collaborative discussions and draw consensus in a diversified groups for achieving optimal results
4.Deal with different types of challenges through practicing real workplace scenarios during workshop

title: Why Coaching Sometimes Fails? The Secrets of Performance Coaching that Engage Heart & Mind
objectives:
1.  Identify common pitfalls that managers fall into when they coach staff 
2.  Apply skills and steps of coaching process to  structure dialogue, coupled with effective choice of words 
3. Examine the art of coaching, how to deliver feedback that engage heart and mind of staff
4.  Identify what makes coaching and delivering feedback challenging with staff

title: Supervisory Skills 101 for Senior Supervisors
objectives:
1. Understand the role of a senior supervisor in alignment with Vision, Mission and Values 
2. Plan and organize works for a team with SMART goals and Plan-Do-Check-Act cycle 
3. Appreciate the Dimensional Leadership and exercise a collaborative approach 
4. Adopt effective supervisory styles according to the development stage of subordinates 
5. Coach and motivate staff to improve performance

title: Participative Communication Leader as a Coach - How to Deliver Effective Conversations & Feedback
objectives:

2.Equip the participants with the right attitude and tools to develop an on-going coaching routine, sustain and/or address the real staff performance issues
3.Raise the participants’ awareness of the importance of active listening and constructive feedback giving
4.Help the participants to inspire and motivate staff to become the best they can be

title: Crucial Conversations® - Coaching Tools for Bringing Up and Resolving Touchy & Complex Issues
objectives:
1.Hold good conversations on sensitive matters such as performance or attitudinal issues.
2.Speak honestly and openly with people no matter how delicate the topic or how powerful the individual is.
3.Create a culture where people can come to an agreement on difficult changes (changing initiatives, new reporting processes, allocation of responsibility of staff, mergers, etc.) and then follow through.
4.Reach a consensus on how to work together and treat one another as teammates.
5.Speak up when things get off track and suggest ways to improve them.

title: The Coaching Clinic®  Certification Programme

3. Enhance their understanding towards the appropriate and proper workplace conduct for the delivery of best professional practices to uphold Corporation image 
4. Appreciate the importance of maintaining harmonious relations as well as the roles and responsibilities of supervisors in staff engagement 
5. Make sound judgement and decision with effective job delegation and empowerment

title: SHINE Leadership Programme for in-programme EA
objectives:

objectives:

2. Enrich your knowledge on MTR business and corporate/community experiences

title: Executive Continuous Learning Programme – Business Acumen Series
objectives:
1. Enhancing our awareness to market business information & insights, with learning focus on market awareness, financial decision, business analytics
2. Enhance capability to analyse business situations & draw insights from external environment for a big-picture view to create business values

title: Executive Continuous Learning Programme – Finance & Economic Series
objectives:
1. Strengthen your capability and knowledge of key financial elements to make sound decisions
2. Enhace capability to develop finance and investment strategies that maximize values for the organisation

title: Executive Continuous Learning Programme – Leadership Series
objectives:

2. Enhance your organizational leadership and strategic management skills to develop and drive sound competitive strategies

title: Executive Continuous Learning Programme – Mainland China & International Business Series
objectives:

2. Learn and share key elements in formulating winning strategies in specific business focuses

title: Strategic Change Leaders for Success (SCLS) Programme
audience: For EM, M30 and M20 colleagues who have recently reached their current role through career advancement.
objectives:
1. Enhance leaders’ capability in building an engaged team with high effectiveness and focus on the right priorities to realise the corporate strategy 
2. Elevate the awareness and ability in fostering a collaborative and trust-based culture that encourages the openness to speak up for organisational success 
3. Facilitate the development of influential change leaders with all-round decision making to enhance the team’s agility in adapting to change

title: Reaching New Horizons - Leadership Transformation Programme (RHLT) for Newly Promoted M10 Managers
audience: For newly promoted managers at Grade M10
objectives:
1. Acquire staff with effective strategies/skills to enhance the self-efficacy in managing change/ personal transitions in roles and broaden responsibilities whilst building resilience in adverse situations 
2. Discover the roles, skills and mindset as an effective team leader 
3. Uplift their competencies in coaching and engaging staff for better performance management and continuous improvement 
4. Foster a mutual care, supportive and empowering environment in which all individuals are embedded in a network of care, trust and reciprocity to maintain harmonious staff relations whilst enabling individuals to make decision and judgment through effective job delegation and empowerment

title: Train-the-Trainer Programme for Station Line Trainers
objectives:

•    Learn techniques for training delivery and Q&A handling 
•    Learn some tips on conducting service coaching and effective briefing

3. Write Chinese correspondences in the proper way

title: Understanding Chinese Grammar II
audience: Staff who are required to write articles, reports, notices, speeches and/or other documents in Chinese language in their daily work. (Pre-requisition: Staff who have completed TIA575 Understanding Chinese Grammar I)
objectives:
1. Further improve their Chinese grammar 
2. Understand the common mistakes made in sentence constructions 
3. Construct sentences in the proper way

title: Mastering Influencing Skills for Impact
audience: For managers who need to exercise influencing at work, via personal power vs. position power.
objectives:
1. Influencing customers or vendors to strike a business deal 
2. Handling a difficult complaint 
3. Winning over a challenging customer or internal partner who have competing or very different objectives from yours 
4. Selling an idea across to management to secure support and resources 
5. Upturning a low-trust relationship that you have simply inherited

title: Performance Management Skills for Managers
objectives:
1.Understand the performance-management process and the roles of the appraiser
2.Grasp the skills needed for setting Key Result Areas (KRAs) by linking key objectives to the business plan
3.Enhance the understanding of VMV and its application in the workplace
4.Boost coaching skills to manage ongoing performance
5.Conduct performance-appraisal interviews effectively

title: Performance Management Skills for Supervisors (Introductory Course)
objectives:
1. Understand the performance-management process and roles of appraiser 
2. Grasp the skills of setting key objectives 
3. Enhance the understanding of VMV and its application in the workplace 
4. Enhance the skills of conducting coaching to manage ongoing performance 
5. Conduct performance-appraisal interviews effectively

title: Understanding Complaints and Objections
objectives:
1. Adopt the right attitude to handle customers’ complaints and objections
2. Prevent customers from becoming difficult at the early stage
3. Handle the persistent complaints promptly and effectively.

title: Managing Customer Complaints and Objection Handling
objectives:
1. Understand supervisor’s role in leading the team in complaint/objection handling
2. Learn ways to lead and coach the team to adopt the right attitude and use the right skills when handling customers’ complaints and objections
3. Understand the importance of follow up work after customer complaints and objections

title: Enhancing Service Skills for Providing Assistance to PwDs
venue: The Federation's Head Office at Wang Tau Hom Estate
objectives: 1. Acquire some service skills for providing assistance to passengers with disability

title: Enhancing Service Skills for Providing Assistance to PwDs
venue: The Federation's Head Office at Wang Tau Hom Estate
objectives: 1. Acquire some service skills for providing assistance to passengers with disability

title: EQ & Stress Management
objectives:
1. Understand more about Emotional Quotient (EQ)
2. Equip with knowledge and practical skills for enhancing EQ and releasing stress at workplace

title: Field Coaching for Station Supervisor (2-hour session)
objectives:
1. Understand the importance of "Service Coaching" 
2. Learn how to provide positive and constructive feedback

title: Leading an Effective Briefing
objectives:
1. Plan and structure "What" to brief
2. Learn "How" to brief precisely and persuasively
3. Equip with some tips on handling audiences' questions

title: Mental Health First Aid Course
objectives:
1. Learn how to identify and handle potential risks cautiously when facing challenging situations
2. Gain some tips on handling customers with violence tendency

title: Serving Internal Customers with Empathy
objectives:

3. Learn to how manage self' and others' emotions when providing assistance under difficult situations

title: WIT Stage presentation skills
objectives: 1. To develop and practice the skills of stage presentation
